distanthorizons.title: Distant Horizons
distanthorizons.updater.title: Distant Horizons auto updater
distanthorizons.updater.text2: §fDo you want to update from %s§f to %s§f?
distanthorizons.updater.update.@tooltip:
Updates the mod this one time
(Updates when game is closed)
distanthorizons.updater.silent.@tooltip:
Every time an update is available, it would update
(§6WARNING§r: This wont prompt you when updating)
distanthorizons.updater.waitingForClose: Distant Horizons will finish updating once the game restarts
distanthorizons.config.title: Distant Horizons config
distanthorizons.config.client.quickEnabl: Determines if Distant Horizons Renders LODs.
distanthorizons.config.client.quickShowW: If true then the world gen/importing progress will be displayed on the screen when running.
distanthorizons.config.client.qualityPre:
Modifies a number of graphical settings to quickly change Distant Horizons' rendering quality. 

Lower this setting if your GPU is at max usage or you are having framerate issues.
distanthorizons.config.client.threadPres:
Modifies how many threads Distant Horizons' will use. 

Increasing this setting will improve the Distant Generator speed and LOD loading speed, 
but will also increase CPU/memory usage and may introduce stuttering. 

Note: This is a CPU relative setting. 
It should put an equal amount of strain on a 2 core CPU as a 64 core CPU.
distanthorizons.config.client.optionsBut: Show the config button to the left of the fov button
distanthorizons.config.client.advanced.g:
Distant Horizons' render distance, measured in chunks. 

Note: this is a best effort number. 
The render distance may be above or below this number 
depending on your other graphic settings.

How far apart drops in quality are.

Higher settings will increase the distance between drops
but will increase memory and GPU usage.

The maximum detail LODs are rendered at.

§6Fastest:§r Chunk
§6Fanciest:§r Block

How well LODs represent overhangs, caves, cliffsides, etc.

Higher options will increase memory and GPU usage.

How quickly LODs drop off in quality.

Larger numbers will improve how distant terrain looks
but will increase memory and GPU usage.
Defines the types of blocks to ignore when generating LODs.

§4Note: makes snow, carpet, and trapdoors look really bad§r
Should the blocks underneath avoided blocks gain the color of the avoided block?
§6True:§r a red flower on grass will tint the grass below it red
§6False:§r skipped blocks will not change color of surface below them

Sets vanilla's lod bias value
Please press F3+T to reload your texture packs when changing this value to apply it.

Defines how LODs should be shaded. 
Can be used to improve shader compatibility.
How should the sides and bottom of grass block LODs render?

If true LODs will fade away as you get closer to them. 
If false LODs will cut off abruptly at a set distance from the camera. 
This setting is affected by the vanilla overdraw prevention config.

How should vanilla Minecraft fade into Distant Horizons LODs? 

NONE: Fastest, there will be a pronounced border between DH and MC rendering. 
SINGLE_PASS: Fades after MC's transparent pass, opaque blocks underwater won't be faded. 
DOUBLE_PASS: Slowest, fades after both MC's opaque and transparent passes, provides the smoothest transition.

How bright LOD colors are.

0 = black 
1 = normal 
2 = near white

How saturated LOD colors are.

0 = black and white 
1 = normal 
2 = vibrant

This is the same as vanilla Biome Blending settings for LOD area. 

Note that anything other than '0' will greatly effect Lod building time
and increase triangle count. The cost on chunk generation speed is also 
quite large if set to too high.

'0' equals to Vanilla Biome Blending of '1x1', 
'1' equals to Vanilla Biome Blending of '3x3', 
'2' equals to Vanilla Biome Blending of '5x5'...
Ambient Occlusion adds depth to the lighting of blocks.

Determines how many points in space are sampled for the occlusion test. 
Higher numbers will improve quality and reduce banding, but will increase GPU load.
Determines the radius Screen Space Ambient Occlusion is applied, measured in blocks.
Determines how dark the Screen Space Ambient Occlusion effect will be.
Increasing the value can reduce banding at the cost of reducing the strength of the effect.

Determines how dark the occlusion shadows can be. 
0 = totally black at the corners 
1 = no shadow

The radius, measured in pixels, that blurring is calculated for the SSAO. 
Higher numbers will reduce banding at the cost of GPU performance.

If true non terrain objects will be rendered in DH's terrain. 
This includes beacon beams and clouds.

Sets the maximum height at which beacons will render. 
This will only affect new beacons coming into LOD render distance. 
Beacons currently visible in LOD chunks will not be affected.
If true LOD beacon beams will be rendered.
If true LOD clouds will be rendered.

Can be disabled to use much slower but more compatible direct rendering. 
Disabling this can be used to fix some crashes on Mac.
Determines if fog is drawn on DH LODs.
The color of the fog on LODs.

§6True:§r Minecraft renders fog like normal.
§6False:§r disables Minecraft's fog on vanilla chunks.

May cause issues with other mods that edit fog.

Where should the fog start? 

  '0.0': Fog start at player's position.
  '1.0': The fog-start's circle fit just in the lod render distance square.
'1.414': The lod render distance square fit just in the fog-start's circle.

Where should the fog end? 

  '0.0': Fog end at player's position.
  '1.0': The fog-end's circle fit just in the lod render distance square.
'1.414': The lod render distance square fit just in the fog-end's circle.

What is the minimum fog thickness? 

  '0.0': No fog at all.
  '1.0': Fully fog color.

What is the maximum fog thickness? 

  '0.0': No fog at all.
  '1.0': Fully fog color.

How should the fog thickness should be calculated? 

LINEAR: Linear based on distance (will ignore 'density')
EXPONENTIAL: 1/(e^(distance*density)) 
EXPONENTIAL_SQUARED: 1/(e^((distance*density)^2)

Defines how height effects fog. 
When in doubt start with SPHERICAL, ADDITION, or MAX. 

SPHERICAL: Fog is calculated based on camera distance. 
CYLINDRICAL: Ignore height, fog is calculated based on horizontal distance. 
MAX: max(heightFog, farFog) 
ADDITION: heightFog + farFog 
MULTIPLY: heightFog * farFog 
INVERSE_MULTIPLY: 1 - (1-heightFog) * (1-farFog) 
LIMITED_ADDITION: farFog + max(farFog, heightFog) 
MULTIPLY_ADDITION: farFog + farFog * heightFog 
INVERSE_MULTIPLY_ADDITION: farFog + 1 - (1-heightFog) * (1-farFog) 
AVERAGE: farFog*0.5 + heightFog*0.5

Where should the height fog be located? 

ABOVE_CAMERA: Height fog starts from camera to the sky 
BELOW_CAMERA: Height fog starts from camera to the void 
ABOVE_AND_BELOW_CAMERA: Height fog starts from camera to both the sky and the void 
ABOVE_SET_HEIGHT: Height fog starts from a set height to the sky 
BELOW_SET_HEIGHT: Height fog starts from a set height to the void 
ABOVE_AND_BELOW_SET_HEIGHT: Height fog starts from a set height to both the sky and the void
If the height fog is calculated around a set height, what is that height position?

How far the start of height fog should offset? 

  '0.0': Fog start with no offset.
  '1.0': Fog start with offset of the entire world's height. (Include depth)

How far the end of height fog should offset? 

  '0.0': Fog end with no offset.
  '1.0': Fog end with offset of the entire world's height. (Include depth)

What is the minimum fog thickness? 

  '0.0': No fog at all.
  '1.0': Fully fog color.

What is the maximum fog thickness? 

  '0.0': No fog at all.
  '1.0': Fully fog color.

How should the height fog thickness should be calculated? 

LINEAR: Linear based on height (will ignore 'density')
EXPONENTIAL: 1/(e^(height*density)) 
EXPONENTIAL_SQUARED: 1/(e^((height*density)^2)
What is the height fog's density?
If enabled a noise texture will be applied to LODs to simulate textures.
Determines how many steps of noise should be applied to the LODs.
Determines how intense the noise texture is.

Defines how far should the noise texture render before it fades away. (in blocks). 
Set to 0 to disable noise from fading away.

Determines how far from the camera Distant Horizons will start rendering. 
Measured as a percentage of the vanilla render distance.
0 = Auto, overdraw will change based on the vanilla render distance.

Higher values will prevent LODs from rendering behind vanilla blocks at a higher distance,
but may cause holes to appear in the LODs. 
Holes are most likely to appear when flying through unloaded terrain. 

Increasing the vanilla render distance increases the effectiveness of this setting.

If enabled caves will be culled 

Additional Info: Currently this cull all faces 
 with skylight value of 0 under the cave culling height in dimensions that 
 do not have a ceiling.
At what Y value should cave culling start?

If true beacons near the camera won't be drawn to prevent vanilla overdraw. 
If false all beacons will be rendered.

If false LODs outside the player's camera 
aren't drawn, increasing GPU performance. 

If true all LODs are drawn, even those behind 
the player's camera, decreasing GPU performance. 

Disable this if you see LODs disappearing at the corners of your vision.

Identical to the other frustum culling option except that it is 
only used when a shader mod is present using the DH API 
and the shadow pass is being rendered. 

Disable this if shadows render incorrectly.

A comma separated list of block resource locations that won't be rendered by DH. 
Note: air is always included in this list.

A comma separated list of block resource locations that shouldn't be rendered 
if they are in a 0 sky light underground area. 
Note: air is always included in this list.

A value of 1 is equivalent to the curvature of Earth in real life. 
The minimum accepted value is 50 and the maximum value is 5000. 
Everything between 1 and 49 will be rounded up to 50.
distanthorizons.config.client.advanced.a: Automatically updates the mod when an update is available

Where to download the latest update from. 

Auto: Downloads either stable or nightly builds based on the current jar. 
Stable: Stable builds from Modrinth. 
Nightly: Nightly builds from Gitlab.
distanthorizons.config.client.advanced.m:
Determines the folder format for local multiplayer data.

§6Name Only:§r
Uses the server browser name. Ex: "Minecraft Server"
§6IP Only:§r
"192.168.1.40"
§6Name IP:§r
"Minecraft Server, IP 192.168.1.40"
§6Name, IP, Port:§r
"Minecraft Server, IP 192.168.1.40:25565"
§6Name, IP, Port, MC Version:§r
"Minecraft Server, IP 192.168.1.40:25565, GameVersion 1.18.1"

§c§lCaution:§r changing while connected to a multiplayer server may cause glitches.
distanthorizons.config.client.advanced.d:
If enabled this will disable (most) vanilla Minecraft rendering. 

NOTE: Do not report any issues when this mode is on! 
This setting is only for fun and debugging. 
Mod compatibility is not guaranteed.
If enabled the LODs will render as wireframe.
§6True:§r debug keybindings can be used to change the Debug mode in game.

If enabled, vertex color will not be passed.
Useful for debugging shaders.

If true overlapping quads will be rendered as bright red for easy identification. 
If false the quads will be rendered normally.

If true OpenGL Buffer garbage collection will be logged 
this also includes the number of live buffers.

If enabled, very limited config input validation will be performed. 

Warning: enabling this can cause instability or crashing, use at your own risk. 
Note: this option isn't saved between sessions.
If enabled, various wireframes for debugging internal functions will be drawn.
Show Network Sync On Load Queue

Defines how OpenGL errors are handled. 
 Requires rebooting Minecraft to apply. 
May incorrectly catch OpenGL errors thrown by other mods.

Defines how OpenGL errors are handled. 
 Requires rebooting Minecraft to apply. 
May incorrectly catch OpenGL errors thrown by other mods.

Massively reduces FPS. 
Should only be used if mysterious EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION crashes are happening in DH's rendering code and you're attempting to troubleshoot it.
This screen is to debug features of the config screen
The value of this should be the same as in Category Test
distanthorizons.config.common.worldGener:
§6True:§r in single player LODs will be created outside the vanilla render distance.
Depending on the Generator Mode pre-existing chunks will be important and/o
missing chunks will be generated.
Note: this can use a large amount of CPU.

§6False:§r LODs will only generate within the vanilla render distance.
How complicated the generation should be when generating LODs outside the vanilla render distance.
Determines how should distant generator progress be displayed.
Determines how long between progress update displays.
Seconds To Show Progress Hiding Instructions

For how many seconds should instructions for disabling the distant generator progress be displayed? 
Setting this to 0 hides the instructional message so the world gen progress is shown immediately when it starts.
distanthorizons.config.common.lodBuildin:
Disabling this check may fix issues where LODs aren't updated after
blocks have been changed.

If true LOD generation for pre-existing chunks will attempt to pull the lighting data 
saved in Minecraft's Region files. 
If false DH will pull in chunks without lighting and re-light them. 

Setting this to true will result in faster LOD generation 
for already generated worlds, but is broken by most lighting mods. 

Set this to false if LODs are black.
Setting this to true may solve some issues when using DH with a pre-generated world.

What algorithm should be used to compress new LOD data? 
This setting will only affect new or updated LOD data, 
any data already generated when this setting is changed will be 
unaffected until it needs to be re-written to the database. 

Fastest: LZ4 
Highest Compression: LZMA2

How should block data be compressed when creating LOD data? 
This setting will only affect new or updated LOD data, 
any data already generated when this setting is changed will be 
unaffected until it is modified or re-loaded. 

Most Accurate: Merge Same Blocks 
Highest Compression: Visually Equal

True: Recalculate chunk height maps before chunks can be used by DH. This can fix problems with worlds created by external tools. 
False: Assume any height maps handled by Minecraft are correct. 

Fastest: False
Most Compatible: True
Upsample Lower Detail LODs To Fill Holes

When active DH will attempt to fill missing LOD data 
with any data that is present in the tree, preventing holes when moving 
when a N-sized generator (or server) is active. 

§6EXPERIMENTAL§r Will increase harddrive use and may cause rendering issues. 
See the config file for more details.
distanthorizons.config.common.multiThrea: How many threads DH will use.
distanthorizons.config.common.logging.@t: Controls how logging should be handled.
distanthorizons.config.common.logging.wa: Show Low Memory Warning On Startup
If DH detects that pooled objects are being garbage collected this will send a chat warning.
Show High Vanilla Render Distance Warning
distanthorizons.config.server.sendLevelK:
Makes the server send level keys for each world.
Disable this if you use alternative ways to send level keys.
distanthorizons.config.server.levelKeyPr:
Prefix of the level keys sent to the clients.
If the mod is running behind a proxy, each backend should use a unique value.
If this value is empty, level key will be based on the server's seed hash.
distanthorizons.config.server.generation:
How many LOD generation requests per second should a client send?
Also limits the number of client requests allowed to stay in the server's queue.
distanthorizons.config.server.maxGenerat: Defines the distance allowed to generate around the player.
distanthorizons.config.server.enableReal: If true, clients will receive real-time LOD updates for chunks outside the client's render distance.
distanthorizons.config.server.realTimeUp: Defines the distance the player will receive updates around.
distanthorizons.config.server.synchroniz: If true, clients will receive updated LODs when joining or loading new LODs.
distanthorizons.config.server.syncOnLoad: Rate Limit for Sync on Load

How many LOD sync requests per second should a client send?
Also limits the number of client's requests allowed to stay in the server's queue.
distanthorizons.config.server.maxSyncOnL: Max Sync on Load Request Distance

Defines the distance allowed to be synchronized around the player.
Should be the same or larger than maxGenerationRequestDistance in most cases.
distanthorizons.config.server.maxDataTra:
Maximum speed for uploading LODs to the clients, in KB/s.
Value of 0 disables the limit.
distanthorizons.config.server.experiment:
When enabled on the client, this allows loading lower detail levels as needed to speed up terrain generation.
This must also be enabled on the server; otherwise, it will have no effect.
For better performance when switching LOD detail levels, enabling [upsampleLowerDetailLodsToFillHoles] is recommended.
distanthorizons.config.enum.EDhApiThread: 5. I Paid For The Whole CPU
